channel.title: reverse engineering on rm -rf /

item.title: xchg rax,rax
item.description: x86-64 Kata The book xchg rax,rax (content available free here) is a collection of 0x40 x86-64 snippets. It has no text other than chunks of assembly language. You read the code and ponder its meaning. Kata for the budding reverse engineer. Spoiler Alert Program 0x03 is pretty neat: sub rdx,rax sbb rcx,rcx and rcx,rdx add rax,rcx Let me spoil this for you: at the end of this program, rax will contain the smaller of the original rax and rdx values.
